fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Exponentials of the form i_!A\Rightarrow i_!B

fr:mainmatter.html:p: Let \mathscr {C} and \mathscr {D} be cartesian closed categories, and let \rho ^*\dashv \rho _*:\mathscr {C}\to \mathscr {D} be an adjunction. Define \mathscr {G} to be the Artin gluing of the right adjoint {\mathscr {C}}\xrightarrow {{\rho _*}}{\mathscr {D}}. Involving \mathscr {C}, we have an adjunction j^*\dashv j_*:\mathscr {C}\hookrightarrow \mathscr {G}; involving \mathscr {D}, we have an adjoint triple i_!\dashv i^*\dashv i_*:\mathscr {D}\hookrightarrow \mathscr {G}. We have canonical isomorphism i^*{\mathopen {}\left ({i_!B}^{i_!A}\right )\mathclose {}}\cong B^A.
